column2: Title of the pane to the left of the initial main menu buttons.
Message shown when no mods have added a button to the Mods pane.
column3: None of your currently installed mods add any buttons to this part of the menu!

column2: Text on the Mod Settings button in the game's settings menu.
Title of the Mod Settings page.
Initial message shown on the mod settings page.
column3: Welcome to Mod Settings! If you're wondering what this new menu is, it's a separate settings menu that mods can add to. This menu is separated from the base game's settings in order to make it less likely to break. Basically, if you're not a mod developer, then don't worry about it.

column2: Message shown when a mod settings tab can't be loaded.
Base game tab name in the gameplay setup pane.
Mods tab name in the gameplay setup pane.
Hover hint of the edit tab visibility (eye) button in the gameplay setup pane.
Error message shown when the gameplay setup tab can't be loaded.

column3: Disable thumbstick scrolling in Mod Settings
Limit control to the scroll bar in mod list to the left of this page. Prevents autoscrolling if you have stick drift.
